item.title: Write Your Own Coda Plug-In
item.author: Adam Jarret (adam@atj.me)
item.description: My love for Coda knows no bounds. Except maybe the bounds of the tab bar.

item.title: Debian: Beep at Login Prompt
item.author: Adam Jarret (adam@atj.me)
item.description: It's sometimes handy to have the system beep when it reaches the log in prompt to announce that it's ready to accept SSH connections.

item.title: Stop Remote Desktop from Locking the Host
item.author: Adam Jarret (adam@atj.me)
item.description: Closing a Windows Remote Desktop connection leaves the host machine locked, but it is possible to create a shortcut that will close the session without locking the screen.

item.title: Google Voice + Fluid (SSB)
item.author: Adam Jarret (adam@atj.me)
item.description: Some helpful tweaks for a Fluid site specific browser for Google Voice.

item.title: Downgrading to Flash Player 9 on Mac OS X
item.author: Adam Jarret (adam@atj.me)
item.description: If you've noticed Safari crashing more often lately on your PowerPC Mac, you're not alone.

item.title: SlingPlayer iPhone App Rated 12+?
item.author: Adam Jarret (adam@atj.me)
item.description: A rating of 12+ seems ludicrous because it takes into account what people could watch while using the app as opposed to what was coded into the app.

item.title: Google DNS vs OpenDNS vs Comcast
item.author: Adam Jarret (adam@atj.me)
item.description: I haven't noticed much of a speed difference but a recent BrowserMob article has me thinking of switching back to my ISP's DNS servers.

item.title: Windows Media Center "Little Red Dot"
item.author: Adam Jarret (adam@atj.me)
item.description: The Show taskbar notifications setting in Windows 7 Media Center (found under Settings>General>Startup and Window Behavior) toggles the appearance of a little red dot in the taskbar when a program is recording.

item.title: Why Isn't the Zune HD a Windows Media Extender?
item.author: Adam Jarret (adam@atj.me)
item.description: If DRM is unavoidable for now then Microsoft could at least take a page out of the iTunes Store playbook and allow users to authorize a certain number of computers and unlimited devices to play recorded media.

item.title: Linus Torvalds Interviewed on FLOSS Weekly
item.author: Adam Jarret (adam@atj.me)
item.description: Episode 88 of Floss Weekly is an interview with Linus Torvalds and is well worth a listen. Linus is spectacularly interesting both with regard to his thoughts on programming and his opinions of the open source movement in general.
